task.name: importasdm
task.shortdescription: Convert an ALMA Science Data Model observation into a CASA visibility file (MS)
task.description: Convert an ALMA Science Data Model observation into a CASA visibility file (MS)

param.name: asdm
param.shortdescription: Name of input asdm directory (on disk)
param.description:
Name of input ASDM file (directory) Default: none
Example: asdm='ExecBlock3'

param.name: vis
param.shortdescription: Root name of the ms to be created. Note the .ms is NOT added
param.description:
Root ms name. Default: none
Note that a prefix (.ms) is NOT appended to this name.

param.name: createmms
param.shortdescription: Create a Multi-MS output
param.description:
Create a Multi-MS partitioned according to the given separation axis. Default: False Options: False|True
For more detailed documentation on partition, Multi-MS and the MPI use in CASA, please see CASA Docs (https://casa.nrao.edu/casadocs/).

param.name: separationaxis
param.shortdescription: Axis to do parallelization across (scan, spw, baseline, auto)
param.description:
Axis to do parallelization across Default: 'auto' Options: 'scan', 'spw', 'baseline', 'auto'
* auto: will partition per scan/spw to obtain optimal load balancing with the following criteria: 1 - Maximize the scan/spw/field distribution across sub-MSs 2 - Generate sub-MSs with similar size * 'scan' or 'spw': will partition the MS into scan or spw. The individual sub-MSs may not be balanced with respect to the number of rows. * 'baseline': mostly useful for Single-Dish data. This axis will partition the MS based on the available baselines. If the user wants only auto-correlations, use the ocorr_mode='ao'. Note that if numsubms='auto', partition will try to create as many subMSs as the number of available servers in the cluster. If the user wants to have one subMS for each baseline, set the numsubms parameter to a number higher than the number of baselines to achieve this.

param.name: numsubms
param.shortdescription: The number of SubMSs to create (auto or any number)
param.description:
The number of sub-MSs to create in the Multi-Ms. Default: 'auto' Options: any integer number (example: numsubms=4)
The default 'auto' is to partition using the number of available servers given when launching CASA. If the task is unable to determine the number of running servers, or the user did not start CASA using mpicasa, numsubms will use 8 as the default.
Example: Launch CASA with 5 engines, where 4 of them will be used to create the MMS (the first engine is used as the MPIClient): mpicasa -n 5 casa --nogui --log2term CASA> importasdm('uid__A1', createmms=True)

param.name: corr_mode
param.shortdescription: Specifies the correlation mode to be considered on input. A quoted string containing a sequence of ao, co, ac,or all separated by whitespaces is expected
param.description: Correlation mode to be considered on input. Default: 'all' Options: ao, co, ac, or all

param.name: srt
param.shortdescription: Specifies the spectral resolution type to be considered on input. A quoted string containing a sequence of fr, ca, bw, or all separated by whitespaces is expected
param.description: Spectral resolution type. Default: 'all' Options: fr, ca, bw, or all

param.name: time_sampling
param.shortdescription: Specifies the time sampling (INTEGRATION and/or SUBINTEGRATION) to be considered on input. A quoted string containing a sequence of i, si, or all separated by whitespaces is expected
param.description:
Specifies the time sampling (INTEGRATION and/or SUBINTEGRATION) to be considered on input. Default: 'all' Options: i, si, or all
A quoted string containing a sequence of i, si, or all separated by whitespaces is expected

param.name: ocorr_mode
param.shortdescription: Output data for correlation mode AUTO_ONLY (ao) or CROSS_ONLY (co) or CROSS_AND_AUTO (ca)
param.description: Output data for correlation mode AUTO_ONLY (ao) or CROSS_ONLY (co) or CROSS_AND_AUTO (ca) Default: 'ca' Options: ao, co, ca

param.name: compression
param.shortdescription: Flag for turning on data compression
param.description: Produce compressed columns in the resulting measurement set. Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: lazy
param.shortdescription: Make the MS DATA column read the ASDM Binary data directly (faster import, smaller MS)
param.description:
Make the MS DATA column read the ASDM Binary data directly (faster import, smaller MS). Default: False Options: False|True
Instead of writing a copy of the visibilities into a standard DATA column, lazy=True will make importasdm only write a lookup-table such that later access to the DATA column will read the ASDM binary visibility data directly. This requires that the ASDM not be removed from its location as long the the DATA column is needed. Use method ms.asdmref() to query and manipulate the reference to the ASDM.
lazy=True will save ca. 50% disk space and accelerate the DATA column access by ca. 10%. lazy=True will only work when there is visibility data in the ASDM, not with pure radiometer data.

param.name: asis
param.shortdescription: Creates verbatim copies of the ASDMtables in the ouput measurement set. Value given must be a string of table names separated by spaces; A * wildcard is allowed.
param.description:
Creates verbatim copies of the ASDM tables in the output measurement set. Default: none
The value given to this option must be a list of table names separated by space characters; the wildcard character '*' is allowed in table names.

param.name: wvr_corrected_data
param.shortdescription: Specifies which values are considerd in the SDM binary data to fill the DATA column in the MAIN table of the MS; yes for corrected, no for uncorrected, both for corrected and uncorrected (resulting in two MSs)
param.description:
Specifies which values are considerd in the ASDM binary data to fill the DATA column in the MAIN table of the MS. Default: no Options: no|yes|both
* no: uncorrected data * yes: corrected data * both: for corrected and uncorrected data. Note if both is selected, two measurement sets are created, one with uncorrected data and the other with corrected data (which name is suffixed by '-wvr-corrected')

param.name: scans
param.shortdescription: Processes only the specified scans. A scan specification consists in an exec bock index followed by the : character, followed by a comma separated list of scan indexes or scan index ranges. (e.g. 0:1;1:2~6,8;2:,3:24~30)
param.description:
Processes only the scans specified in the option's value. Default: none (all scans)
This value is a semicolon separated list of scan specifications. A scan specification consists in an exec bock index followed by the character ':' followed by a comma separated list of scan indexes or scan index ranges. A scan index is relative to the exec block it belongs to. Scan indexes are 1-based while exec blocks's are 0-based.
Examples: '0:1' '2:2~6' '0:1;1:2~6,8;2:,3:24~30' '1,2' '3:' alone will be interpreted as 'all the scans of the exec block#3'. An scan index or a scan index range not preceded by an exec block index will be interpreted as 'all the scans with such indexes in all the exec blocks'.

param.name: ignore_time
param.shortdescription: All the rows of the tables Feed, History, Pointing, Source, SysCal, CalDevice, SysPower, and Weather are processed independently of the time range of the selected exec block / scan.
param.description: All the rows of the tables Feed, History, Pointing, Source, SysCal, CalDevice, SysPower, and Weather are processed independently of the time range of the selected exec block / scan. Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: process_syspower
param.shortdescription: Process the SysPower table?
param.description: The SysPower table is processed if and only if this parameter is set to true. Default: True Options: True|False

param.name: process_caldevice
param.shortdescription: Process the CalDevice table?
param.description: The CalDevice table is processed if and only if this parameter is set to true. Default: True Options: True|False

param.name: process_pointing
param.shortdescription: Process the Pointing table?
param.description:
The Pointing table is processed if and only if this parameter is set to true. Default: True Options: True|False
If set to False, the POINTING table is empty in the resulting MS

param.name: process_flags
param.shortdescription: Create online flags in the FLAG_CMD sub-table?
param.description:
Create online flags based on the Flag.xml, Antenna.xml and SpectralWindow.xml files and copy them to the FLAG_CMD sub-table of the MS. Default: True Options: True|False
The flags will NOT be applied unless the parameter applyflags is set to True. Optionally, the flags can also be saved to an external ASCII file if savecmds is set to True.

param.name: tbuff
param.shortdescription: Time padding buffer (seconds)
param.description:
Time padding buffer (seconds) Subparameter of process_flags=True Default: 0.0
NOTE: this time is in seconds. You should currently set the value of tbuff to be 1.5x the correlator integration time if greater than 1 second. For example, if the SDM has integrations of 3 seconds, set tbuff=4.5. Likewise, set tbuff=15.0 for 10-sec integrations.

param.name: applyflags
param.shortdescription: Apply the flags to the MS.
param.description: Apply the online flags to the MS. Subparameter of process_flags=True Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: savecmds
param.shortdescription: Save flag commands to an ASCII file
param.description: Save the flag commands to an ASCII file given by the parameter outfile. Subparameter of process_flags=True Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: outfile
param.shortdescription: Name of ASCII file to save flag commands
param.description: Filename or list of filenames where to save the online flag commands. Subparameter of process_flags=True Default: '' (it will save on a filename composed from the MS name(s).) E.g., for vis='uid_A02.ms', the outfile will be 'uid_A02_cmd.txt'.

param.name: flagbackup
param.shortdescription: Back up flag column before applying flags.
param.description: Back up flag column before applying flags. Default: True Options: True|False

param.name: verbose
param.shortdescription: Output lots of information while the filler is working
param.description: Produce log output as asdm2MS is being run Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: overwrite
param.shortdescription: Over write an existing MS(s)
param.description:
Over write an existing MS(s) or MS(s), if the option wvr_corrected_data='both' Default: False (do not overwrite) Options: False|True
NOTE: the overwrite parameter affects all the output of the task. If any of the following exist, it will not overwrite them. MS(s), .flagversions, online flag files. When set to True, it will overwrite the MS, .flagversions and online flag file.

param.name: showversion
param.shortdescription: Report the version of asdm2MS being used
param.description: Report the version of asdm2MS being used Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: useversion
param.shortdescription: Version of asdm2MS to be used (v3 default, should work for all data)
param.description: Version of asdm2MS to be used Default: 'v3' (should work for all data)

param.name: bdfflags
param.shortdescription: Set the MS FLAG column according to the ASDM _binary_ flags
param.description: Set the MS FLAG column according to the ASDM _binary_ flags Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: with_pointing_correction
param.shortdescription: Add (ASDM::Pointing::encoder - ASDM::Pointing::pointingDirection) to the value to be written in MS::Pointing::direction
param.description: Add (ASDM::Pointing::encoder - ASDM::Pointing::pointingDirection) to the value to be written in MS::Pointing::direction Default: False Options: False|True

param.name: convert_ephem2geo
param.shortdescription: if True, convert any attached ephemerides to the GEO reference frame (time-spacing not changed)
param.description:
if True, convert any attached ephemerides to the GEO reference frame (time-spacing not changed) Default: True Options: True|False
ALMA uses ephemerides with observer location equal to the ALMA site. For later processing of the radial velocity information in, e.g. cvel, a geocentric ephemeris is needed. Setting this option to True will perform the conversion of positions and velocities on all attached ephemerides in the imported MS. This will neither change the time-spacing nor the duration of the ephemeris. No interpolation in time is done.

param.name: polyephem_tabtimestep
param.shortdescription: Timestep (days) for the tabulation of polynomial ephemerides. A value <= 0 disables tabulation.
param.description:
Timestep (days) for the tabulation of polynomial ephemerides. A value less than or equal to 0 disables tabulation. Default: 0
Presently, VLA data can contain polynomial ephemerides. ALMA data uses tabulated values.
